doc:
Lana Morris https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lana_Morris 0 Lana Morris, born Averil Maureen Anita Morris (11 March 1930 – 28 May 1998) was a British film, stage and television actress during the 1950s and 1960s. She played the role of Helene in the 1967 BBC adaptation of The Forsyte Saga, and appeared in many other television programmes. She worked with Roger Moore in The Saint, appearing on the cover of an early 1960s tie-in reprinting of the novel The Saint in New York. She later became a television panellist. She was also in British films such as I Start Counting. She was married to the BBC executive Ronnie Waldman (1914–1978) (from 1953 to 1978). She died of a heart attack in Windsor, Berkshire, aged 68. Lana_Morris , born Averil_Maureen_Anita_Morris ( 11_March_1930 – 28_May_1998 ) was a_British_film_,_stage_and_television_actress during the_1950s_and_1960s . She played the_role of Helene in the_1967_BBC_adaptation of The_Forsyte_Saga , and appeared in many_other_television_programmes . She worked with Roger_Moore in The_Saint , appearing on the_cover of an_early_1960s_tie-in_reprinting of the_novel_The_Saint in New_York . She later became a_television_panellist . She was also in British_films such_as I Start Counting . She was_married to the_BBC_executive_Ronnie_Waldman_(_1914 – 1978_)_( from 1953 to 1978_) . She died of a_heart_attack in Windsor , Berkshire , aged_68 .
